Bash(python -c "
from linux_kernel_analyzer import get_subsystem_tier, SUBSYSTEM_TIERS
print\(''SUBSYSTEM_TIERS:''\)
for tier, prefixes in SUBSYSTEM_TIERS.items\(\):
    print\(f''  Tier {tier}: {prefixes}''\)
print\(\)

# Test cases
tests = [
    [''fs/ext4/super.c''],
    [''fs/namei.c''],
    [''mm/slab.c''],
    [''net/core/dev.c''],
    [''net/ipv4/tcp.c''],
    [''drivers/gpu/drm/i915/i915_drv.c''],
    [''drivers/net/ethernet/intel/e1000/e1000.c''],
    [''drivers/hwmon/tmp102.c''],
    [''Documentation/devicetree/bindings/foo.yaml''],
    [''Documentation/admin-guide/sysctl.rst''],
    [''kernel/sched/core.c''],
    [''kernel/bpf/verifier.c''],
    [''arch/arm64/boot/dts/vendor/board.dts''],
    [''MAINTAINERS''],
]

for files in tests:
    tier = get_subsystem_tier\(files\)
    print\(f''  {files[0]:55s} -> tier {tier}''\)
")
